The Genitive again is in Greek a mixed case, because in so lar as it is Ablatival it expresses local relations, while in its other uses it is grammatical. In Latin the Ablative is mixed, lor it is local in so far as it expresses place, and grammatical in so far as it expresses the instrument or manner of the verbal action.
